name: Roche Limit
explanation: Roche limit is minimum distance a satellite can orbit before tidal forces tear it apart. Depends on planet radius (R_p), planet density (ρ_p), and satellite density (ρ_s). Inside Roche limit, tidal forces exceed satellite's self-gravity. Explains why Saturn's rings exist and why some moons are stable. Used to understand planetary ring systems.

examples.solution: Rings are inside Roche limit - moon was torn apart by tidal forces
steps: Moon orbited too close to Saturn
Moon was torn apart, forming rings

examples.solution: Moon is far enough from Earth to be outside Roche limit
